questions.question: How do you approach developing a digital marketing strategy for a new product or service?
questions.canonical_answer: I research the target audience, analyze competitors, set goals, choose channels, create content plans, and track performance with clear KPIs.

questions.question: Explain the differences between SEO, SEM, and paid advertising campaigns. How do you decide which to use?
questions.canonical_answer: SEO improves organic visibility, SEM combines SEO and paid search, and paid ads provide quick targeted reach. I choose based on goals, budget, and timeline.

questions.question: How do you measure the success of a digital marketing campaign? What KPIs and metrics do you track?
questions.canonical_answer: I track metrics like CTR, conversion rate, ROI, traffic, engagement, and customer acquisition cost to measure campaign success.

questions.question: How do you use social media platforms strategically to drive engagement and conversions?
questions.canonical_answer: I tailor content to each platform, use trends, run targeted ads, engage with users, and optimize posts for reach and conversions.

questions.question: Explain how you would perform competitor analysis in the digital space.
questions.canonical_answer: I review competitorsâ€™ websites, content, SEO rankings, ads, social engagement, and messaging to identify opportunities and gaps.

questions.question: Describe your experience with email marketing campaigns. How do you improve open and click-through rates?
questions.canonical_answer: I segment audiences, personalize messages, A/B test subject lines, optimize send times, and use clear CTAs to boost open and click rates.

questions.question: What strategies do you use to improve website traffic and lead generation organically?
questions.canonical_answer: I use SEO, high-quality content, blogging, internal linking, keyword optimization, and user experience improvements to grow organic traffic.
